Would not reccomend. Game is completely unfair to new players who will be pitted against veterans with premium items who will quickly murder you over and over again, leaving the experience repetitive. The only way to obtain any sort of level playing field is to begin forking over cash to upgrade every character you have, making this "Free" game more epensive than a contemporary $60 purchase.
In addition, depite the attempts to implement anti-cheating measures, you'll quickly discover many players who seemingly never miss at even the most extreme distances having taken no time to aim or can sustain almost a minute of continued pyro fire without harm.
재미있어요

This game was a blast when in it first came-out, and I loved the humor in the promotional video's (Meet the spy, meet the sniper, etc).    I never really spend money on DLC, but I didnt mind chipping in the occasional couple of bucks for a crate to unlock items.  I thought that was a reasonable scheme for them to make extra cash off of a F2P game.  Since I enjoy the game so much, this seemed worthwhile to 'chip-in'.  On the positive side,  I thought TF2 has always excelled at being a quick 'jump into' game, even with the new casual gaming setup.    If I don't have a tremendous amount of time on my hands, TF2 is one of the best quick-action games out there (IMO).

What tanks this game is the hackers.   It mostly seems to be aimbots. Aimbots with no subtley even.  You round a corner, and you die.... and every other person who rounds the corner also dies... including the cloaked spy.  Its so prevalent that the hackers will joke about being 'VAC'd earlier in the day, as they spam the chat incessantly.   It makes it very difficult to justify trickling any additional money into the game.

Are there avenue's to ditch the hackers in-game?  Sure. You can vote them out if they are on your team. They seem to often come-in groups or three and often start voting non-affiliated people off their team quickly.   

If they aren't on your team... you can report them (which seems to do nothing), or you can basically just leave the game.  That need to leave the game is becoming more common.  I think thats too bad.

Maybe they should allow community moderators (instead of coaches), or even run a basic statistical analysis that says "one player should not have 100% accuracy and over a hundred kills, when the nearest other player only has 7".   Maybe offer moderator privileges to Steam-users with long hours in the game, and a 'stability' on steam from many other game purchases?   I'd pitch in time to look for hackers.  Maybe utilize better automatic responses when enough players report a player?

I don't know what they need to do... but many of the games turn 'unplayable' very quickly.

Good gaming,
This is a best game

I used to love this game, but valve's carelessness left it as a shell of its former self. I used to tell my friends how good the game was all the time but honestly there is no way I can recommend it anymore. Between valve's poor balancing, awful kick system, incompetence, and the lack of communication, playing this game feels more like a chore unless you go to community servers.
Don't let the "100k" player number fool you. it's a lot closer to 20k playing, at most. for a good reason.

Valve anti-cheat is a joke and this game has become unplayable.
I love it still fun after so long

Cuando yo ví el juego por primera vez pensé que no sería bueno, que lo desinstalalaria y que me aburriria, pero cuando lo jugué me arrepenti  de todo lo que había dicho pues quede más que satisfecho. 
Este juego unos modos de juegos fabtasticos, los personajes tiene mucha personalidad, hay variedad de armas para cada clase, los mapas están muy completos y lo más me gustaba del juego eran las burlas que hacían los personajes.

Aunque algunos digan que tf2 es viejo, pues quizás tengan razón pero eso no significa que el juego sea malo aunque este algo viejo no pierde la magia que lo caracteriza

Está en la lista de los juegos mas adictivos que he jugado. Si te descuidas podes pasar mas de 10 horas seguidas disfrutando de esta droga. Te vas a enojar, te vas a cagar de risa, te la vas a medir con otros todo el tiempo, te van a humillar y vas a humillar a muchos, te vas a aliar con otros de tu team para joderle la partida a alguien, una partida amistosa puede convertirse en una tercera guerra mundial, un Powerhouse o un Turbine pueden llegar a durar 2 horas dandolo todo por ganar, una Conga o un kazotsky kick puede arruinarse porque a un idiota se le "escapa" el lanzallamas o un backstab o simplemente el pobre falla con el taunt y todos explotan. Una vez que pasa eso ya no hay vuelta atras, señores. 
Hacerle un buen market gardener a un pobre sniper o a un spy invisible es una de las sensaciones mas geniales que podes tener en el juego. Llegar a 34 muertes seguidas con el soldier y que faltando 3 seg para ganar un spy te la ponga sin piedad. Ser un scout tryhard molesto y que varios del otro equipo se cambien a scout solo para ir a buscarte. Llegar a casi 40 kills seguidas con el scout y que un envidioso de tu equipo te intente kickear. Por la comunidad, por los friendly, por los hackers, por el hermoso caos y por todo lo anterior dicho, gracias Team Fortress 2 por existir. Y al que no le gusta, que se joda. Buenas noches.

I come back to this review 3 years after I wrote it, still with the same giddy enthusiasm about this game even after 4 years of owning the game. Team Fortress 2 gets a lot of shit about a lot of things; hackers, toxic community, and valve's lack of giving 2 shits. But, this never discouraged me from stopping. I first loaded up the game the same night I downloaded it, and it was something of magic. My first match was on koth_viaduct, not having a clue as to what I was doing, but I enjoyed every second of it. I went to bed that night longing for more time to indulge into the game. I played non-stop for months on end, and in only a year I had accumulated 1000 hours. I eventually began to invest money into the Mann Co. store, not just because I like shiny hats and funny looking costumes, but because I held the game up to such high esteem, I had to return my love to the people who made such a lovable game. Today I have accumulated 2300 hours, not necessarily as fast as I did oh so long ago, but still quite a chunk. This being my first ever online computer game, and steam game for that matter, I hold this game as a standard for what I play. I have played many games since that day in September, 2016, but this is the only game that I play to this day and for this long. To others who search for a game that will bring you long-lasting memories, your search may be over.
